courses.name: Orientation: Music Education
courses.description: This course familiarizes and orients students with MU resources, Music Education degree expectations and career options. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Teaching Music I
courses.description: Study of skills, knowledge, and philosophical foundations necessary to teach general music to children in grades preK - 5, including methods, philosophies, and teacher and learner behaviors.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing; music education major or instructor's consent

courses.name: Teaching Music I Field Experience
courses.description: This field experience supports the MUS_EDUC 4140 course. Field experience expectations are delineated in the course syllabus. Graded on a S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing; music education major or instructor's consent

courses.name: Teaching Music II
courses.description: Study of a broad repertoire of music literature and instructional materials, including critical evaluation and analysis for use in the general music classroom.

courses.name: Teaching Music II - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Study of a broad repertoire of music literature and instructional materials, including critical evaluation and analysis for use in the general music classroom.

courses.name: Teaching Music II Field Experience
courses.description: This field experience supports the MUS_EDUC 4142 course. Field experience expectations are delineated in the course syllabus. Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Teaching Music II Field Experience - Writing Intensive
courses.description: This field experience supports the MUS_EDUC 4142 course. Field experience expectations are delineated in the course syllabus. Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Teaching Music III
courses.description: A study of various strategies for the successful teaching of middle and high school music programs.

courses.name: Teaching Music III - Writing Intensive
courses.description: A study of various strategies for the successful teaching of middle and high school music programs.

courses.name: Teaching Music III Field Experience
courses.description: This field experience supports the MUS_EDUC 4144 course. Field experience expectations are delineated in the course syllabus. Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Teaching Music III Field Experience - Writing Intensive
courses.description: This field experience supports the MUS_EDUC 4144 course. Field experience expectations are delineated in the course syllabus. Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Advanced Techniques in Music Education-General
courses.description: A review and evaluation of teaching/learning strategies in general music instruction.

courses.name: Advanced Techniques in Music Education-Early Childhood
courses.description: A review and evaluation of teaching/learning strategies in early childhood music instruction.

courses.name: Curriculum Materials in Music Education-General
courses.description: A development of critical abilities in evaluation and selection of music education materials for general music.

courses.name: Curriculum Materials in Music Education-Vocal
courses.description: A development of critical abilities in evaluation and selection of music education materials for secondary vocal music.

courses.name: Techniques in Instrumental Music Teaching
courses.description: A practical study of the organization and instruction of class teaching, with demonstrations by instructor and class.

courses.name: Teaching Vocal Music
courses.description: Studies in voice development techniques and the organization of choral programs.

courses.name: Foundations of Music Education
courses.description: A study of the history, philosophy and rationale of music education.

courses.name: Measurement and Research in Music Education
courses.description: Introduction to measurement and research strategies and techniques employed by music educators to assess music achievement, aptitude, perception, performance, cognition, and affective development.  Emphasis on reading with understanding and applying research to pedagogical practice.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Psychology of Music Instruction and Performance
courses.description: Introduction to the study of psychological factors, theories and research related to the musical development and performance of children, adolescents, and adults, with implications and applications for music education programs and instruction.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Current Issues in Music Education
courses.description: This course is designed to stimulate thinking about current issues related to the field of music education and the influences of these issues on approaches to music teaching and learning.

courses.name: Administration and Supervision of Music Programs
courses.description: A study of the organization, management, and supervision of music programs.

courses.name: Doctoral Seminar in Music Education
courses.description: Emphasis on knowledge, strategies, and skills necessary for doctoral students to be prepared to make contributions to the profession as successful college teachers, researchers, master teachers in K-12 schools, and arts administrators.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Admission to doctoral study in music education
